trans-unit.source: Use Resource Manager to allocate resources to the Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight| Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Resource Manager to allocate resources to the Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight| Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Resource Manager for Spark clusters on HDInsight for better performance.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Resource Manager for Spark clusters on HDInsight for better performance.

trans-unit.source: Manage resources for the Apache Spark cluster in Azure HDInsight (Linux)
trans-unit.target: Manage resources for the Apache Spark cluster in Azure HDInsight (Linux)

trans-unit.source: Spark on Azure HDInsight (Linux) provides the Ambari Web UI to manage the cluster resources and monitor the health of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Spark on Azure HDInsight (Linux) provides the Ambari Web UI to manage the cluster resources and monitor the health of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Spark History Server to track applications that have finished running on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Spark History Server to track applications that have finished running on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can use the YARN UI to monitor that are currently running on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can use the YARN UI to monitor that are currently running on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This article provides instructions on how to access these UIs and how to perform some basic resource management tasks using these interfaces.
trans-unit.target: This article provides instructions on how to access these UIs and how to perform some basic resource management tasks using these interfaces.

trans-unit.source: **Prerequisites:**
trans-unit.target: **Prerequisites:**

trans-unit.source: You must have the following:
trans-unit.target: You must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: An Apache Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux.
trans-unit.target: An Apache Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Create Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-jupyter-spark-sql.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Create Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-jupyter-spark-sql.md).

trans-unit.source: How do I launch the Ambari Web UI?
trans-unit.target: How do I launch the Ambari Web UI?

trans-unit.source: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).
trans-unit.target: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).

trans-unit.source: You can also navigate to your cluster under **Browse All** > **HDInsight Clusters**.
trans-unit.target: You can also navigate to your cluster under **Browse All** > **HDInsight Clusters**.

trans-unit.source: From the Spark cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: From the Spark cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: ![Launch Ambari](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/hdispark.cluster.launch.dashboard.png "Start Resource Manager")
trans-unit.target: ![Launch Ambari](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/hdispark.cluster.launch.dashboard.png "Start Resource Manager")

trans-unit.source: This should launch the Ambari Web UI, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: This should launch the Ambari Web UI, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: ![Ambari Web UI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/ambari-web-ui.png "Ambari Web UI")
trans-unit.target: ![Ambari Web UI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/ambari-web-ui.png "Ambari Web UI")

trans-unit.source: How do I launch the Spark History Server?
trans-unit.target: How do I launch the Spark History Server?

trans-unit.source: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).
trans-unit.target: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).

trans-unit.source: From the cluster blade, under **Quick Links**, click **Cluster Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: From the cluster blade, under **Quick Links**, click **Cluster Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Cluster Dashboard** blade, click **Spark History Server**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Cluster Dashboard** blade, click **Spark History Server**.

trans-unit.source: ![Spark History Server](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/launch-history-server.png "Spark History Server")
trans-unit.target: ![Spark History Server](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/launch-history-server.png "Spark History Server")

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: How do I launch the Yarn UI?
trans-unit.target: How do I launch the Yarn UI?

trans-unit.source: You can use the YARN UI to monitor applications that are currently running on the Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can use the YARN UI to monitor applications that are currently running on the Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: Before accessing the YARN UI, you should have enabled SSH tunneling to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Before accessing the YARN UI, you should have enabled SSH tunneling to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md)
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md)

trans-unit.source: Launch the Ambari Web UI as shown in the section above.
trans-unit.target: Launch the Ambari Web UI as shown in the section above.

trans-unit.source: From the Ambari Web UI, select YARN from the list on the left of the page.
trans-unit.target: From the Ambari Web UI, select YARN from the list on the left of the page.

trans-unit.source: 3.When the YARN service information is displayed, select **Quick Links**.
trans-unit.target: 3.When the YARN service information is displayed, select **Quick Links**.

trans-unit.source: A list of the cluster head nodes will appear.
trans-unit.target: A list of the cluster head nodes will appear.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the head nodes, and then select **ResourceManager UI**.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the head nodes, and then select **ResourceManager UI**.

trans-unit.source: ![Launch YARN UI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/launch-yarn-ui.png "Launch YARN UI")
trans-unit.target: ![Launch YARN UI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/launch-yarn-ui.png "Launch YARN UI")

trans-unit.source: This should launch the YARN UI and you should see a page similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This should launch the YARN UI and you should see a page similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: ![YARN UI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/yarn-ui.png "YARN UI")
trans-unit.target: ![YARN UI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/yarn-ui.png "YARN UI")

trans-unit.source: How do I manage resources using the Ambari Web UI?
trans-unit.target: How do I manage resources using the Ambari Web UI?

trans-unit.source: Here are some common scenarios that you might run into with your Spark cluster, and the instructions on how to address those using the Ambari Web UI.
trans-unit.target: Here are some common scenarios that you might run into with your Spark cluster, and the instructions on how to address those using the Ambari Web UI.

trans-unit.source: I do not use BI with Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: I do not use BI with Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: How do I take the resources back?
trans-unit.target: How do I take the resources back?

trans-unit.source: Launch the Ambari Web UI as shown above.
trans-unit.target: Launch the Ambari Web UI as shown above.

trans-unit.source: From the left navigation pane, click **Spark**, and then click **Configs**.
trans-unit.target: From the left navigation pane, click **Spark**, and then click **Configs**.

trans-unit.source: In the list of configurations available, look for **Custom spark-thrift-sparkconf** and change the values for **spark.executor.memory** and **spark.drivers.core** to **0**.
trans-unit.target: In the list of configurations available, look for **Custom spark-thrift-sparkconf** and change the values for **spark.executor.memory** and **spark.drivers.core** to **0**.

trans-unit.source: ![Resources for BI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/spark-bi-resources.png "Resources for BI")
trans-unit.target: ![Resources for BI](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/spark-bi-resources.png "Resources for BI")

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a description for the changes you made and then click **Save** again.
trans-unit.target: Enter a description for the changes you made and then click **Save** again.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the page, you should see a prompt to restart the Spark service.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the page, you should see a prompt to restart the Spark service.

trans-unit.source: Click **Restart** for the changes to take affect.
trans-unit.target: Click **Restart** for the changes to take affect.

trans-unit.source: My Jupyter notebooks are not running as expected.
trans-unit.target: My Jupyter notebooks are not running as expected.

trans-unit.source: How can I restart the service?
trans-unit.target: How can I restart the service?

trans-unit.source: Launch the Ambari Web UI as shown above.
trans-unit.target: Launch the Ambari Web UI as shown above.

trans-unit.source: From the left navigation pane, click **Jupyter**, click **Service Actions**, and then click **Restart All**.
trans-unit.target: From the left navigation pane, click **Jupyter**, click **Service Actions**, and then click **Restart All**.

trans-unit.source: This will start the Jupyter service on all the headnodes.
trans-unit.target: This will start the Jupyter service on all the headnodes.

trans-unit.source: ![Restart Jupyter](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/restart-jupyter.png "Restart Jupyter")
trans-unit.target: ![Restart Jupyter](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-resource-manager/restart-jupyter.png "Restart Jupyter")
